alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cheyenne and northeastern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 700 PM MDT/800 PM CDT/... At 629 PM MDT/729 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of St. Francis. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Cheyenne and northeastern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm is producing strong winds resulting in some blowing dust in northern Sherman County. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
